bio.p: Eugene N. Muratov is a research associate professor and associate director of the Laboratory for Molecular Modeling at the UNC Eshelman School of Pharmacy, UNC-Chapel Hill. He was awarded an MSc in the technology of organic substances from Odessa National Polytechnic University in 2000 and a PhD in organic chemistry in 2004 from the A.V. Bogatsky Physical-Chemical Institute. From 2014 to 2020, he was a visiting professor at the Federal Universities of Goias and Paraiba, Brazil. His research interests are in the areas of cheminformatics (especially QSAR), computer-assisted drug design, antiviral research, computational toxicology, and medicinal chemistry.
